phrase.item: Our outfits and other traditional clothing have come down to us from our ancestors.
These are jarab, or traditional socks.
The print is [designed] with [what we call the] "hundred- leaved flower", the peony.
These socks have floral, peony designs.
Down to today we haven't forgotten our handicrafts. We also still knit socks and wear them, brides and grooms also wear them. The same with traditional [dress],
it still exists today.
This [white] chenille was used in the past and is still used today, including the cuffs and plackets. It was used back in those days and we still haven't forgotten it.
It still exists, but for a time it disappeared.
Then we tried hard and made a contribution by bringing [the tradition] back.
We have been keeping up the sewing and [designing]
Today, our [traditional] sewing is well known.
The same with [traditional] hats.
There was a time when nobody used hats.

Then we started sewing [them] again. Brides and grooms started using them constantly and again it went back to the way it was used in the past. Today both bride and groom want to wear these hats on [their wedding day] and they make it a special request to wear traditional outfits.
So today we make [traditional clothes] for them
and they wear them [on their wedding day].
This is a necklace.
It has also been passed down to us
from ancient times. Imitating them, we learned how to make it by ourselves. Even young girls make them now, and almost everyone wears them [at any event].
Brides esepcially use them.
We also wear them on different holidays and at special events.
These are leather shoes and they have been used since then.
Back in those days, there was nothing to put on, so men would make such shoes and everyone— kids, men and women— all started using them.
Also on the wedding day, brides [and grooms] used to wear these shoes.
These brooches and purses are also old. These are all old.
They used to pin these on the bride's upper clothes [on the chest].
All of these were used for the bride.
‎‎On the bride's chest.
This one is called "Pishowiz" [the one hanging in front]
Here we hold small holding knives, and here we keep a needle,
or many needles, and here we put make-up stuff, rings and other things are kept here.
They also existed in the past.
This hat was the first type of hat made the first time
All young and old people used to wear this.
This type of hat is called "kibiri" and was the original type hat was used in the past.
Up till today we use it.
As my sister here mentioned, at one time it disappeared and then came back again, now it is in use.
This [jewelry] used to be hung from the bride's chest.
This is silver. And it was told in the past that that gold and silver are good [healthy] things to be kept with a person.
So that's why we hang it and put needles inside. This one is used to keep make-up,
rings and other extra jewelry.
This bracelet is also very old.
This bracelet, this brooch, and earrings are all very old.
These were left over from our ancestors.
They have passed from our great- grandmothers to our grandmothers, then to our mothers and from our mothers to us.
From us it will pass to our grandchildren.
We keep them all and pass them on to the next generation [in the family].
For making hats, originally they used only this design.
Then later they learned flowers and designed flowers.
At the beginning only one type of design was used,
in ancient times.
Later, they learned more designs and sewed with all different kinds of flowers.
I am wearing a headband, and this also was used in the past. Our grandmothers and mothers used to wear this headband.
Today this headband is almost not in use among the people. Today nobody wears it. In the past they used it for the bride as well.
Even now (sometimes) today we use it, but only for brides.
this type of headband.
This is "kalamfur" [jewelry made of herbs, giving off a good smell] Brides and old women used to carry it. It was used as a perfume for the brides,
it has a strong nice smell.
This big brooch is also very, very old.
It has been passed down to us from one of our great-grandmothers.
Old women, our grand-mothers, used to carry them. They passed it to me when they made me a bride.
These shoes were made in a time of poverty.

There wasn't any other type of shoes back then. They used to make these and wore them everyday. These [shoes] are dyed. There is a specific type of grass that was used for dying, as modern dyes colors didn't exist at the time.
That grass can be found in the mountains. Lastly, this basket is also an old object.
It's used for keeping wool and other small objects, such as yarn, while knitting.
There are also bigger baskets which are used for keeping bread.
It is made strong, for keeping bread.
